result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfred Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to any sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to any sentence currently serving

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:46 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM967, 15CM1464, 15CF639, & 15CF1174. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig by Zoom Video; Deft appears by Zoom Audio from Federal Prison in Florida, pro se. 
Date and time set for hrg in response to deft's letter dated 6/11/2020 re: fees/fines. 
COURT questions deft if any files besides 15CM1464 have a fine imposed. 
Deft makes statement. 
State confirms that only case with fine is 15CM1464. 
COURT makes findings and notes only authority is to reduce fines to community service. 
COURT reduces fine in 15CM1464 to community service.

Clerk Marisa.

from defendant to Court requesting modification of JOC regarding fees; cc ADA Kerri Puig and Atty Andrew Morgan; stj
05-03-19 Plea & Sentencing Transcript

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:03 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF639, 15CF1174, 15CM967, 15CM1464, 15CM1908, 16CF117, 16CF588, AND 15TR3395. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears by phone from Federal Custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 

**BENCH WARRANTS QUASHED**

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

Atty Morgan notes 16CF588 was previously dismissed WITHOUT prejudice and requests that file be dismissed WITH prejudice. 
No objection. 
COURT grants - 16CF588 is dismissed WITH prejudice. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF1174: Ct. 3>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1464: Ct. 2>>DISMISS. 
                       : Cts. 3 & 4>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1908: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 16CF117: Cts. 1-6>>D&RI. 
In 15TR3395: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF639: Ct. 1 (Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1174: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM967: Ct. 1 (Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM1464: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF639: Ct. 1>>4 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
                    : Ct. 2>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 1 yr ES. 
In 15CF1174: Ct. 1>>4 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
                      : Ct. 2>>9 months MCJ. 
In 15CM967: Ct. 1>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 1 yr ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with D.R.; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 

In 15CM1464: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: $1694 inclusive; 45 days MCJ; 24 months dl revocation with admin credit; 24 months IID; AODA (credit should be given if already done); 6pts against dl. 

COURT finds the def entitled to 309 days jail credit in ALL files. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other and CONCURRENT to any sentence def is currently serving. 
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Deft requests copies of disposition in mail. 
COURT notes Clerk's Office to send JOCs to deft. 

Adj: 2:27 pm

Includes 16CF588, 15CF639, 15CF1174, 16CF117, 15CM1908, 15CM1464 and 15CM967.   No contact with D.R., T.F., M.L., A.S., S.M.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall not consume alcohol.    Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting.   No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
